Package org.thewhitemage13.repository

Interface CommentRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Comment,Long>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Comment,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<Comment,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<Comment,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Comment,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Comment>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Comment,Long>
@Repository public interface CommentRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Comment,Long>
Repository interface for managing Comment entities.

This interface extends JpaRepository to provide basic CRUD operations for Comment entities, along with custom query methods for operations related to comments, posts, and users. It allows for efficient querying and modification of the underlying data store, specifically targeting comments associated with posts and users.

Key Methods:

  • Find all comments by post ID.
  • Count the number of comments for a specific post.
  • Delete all comments by user ID.
  • Delete all comments by post ID.
  • Find all comments by post ID.
  • Find all comments by user ID.

Usage:

This repository is automatically injected by Spring and is used for interacting with the Comment entity in the database. It provides both standard CRUD operations and custom queries tailored to the needs of the comment management functionality.

Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Mukhammed Lolo

  • Method Details

    • findAllByPostId

      Optional<List<Comment>> findAllByPostId(Long id)
      Retrieves a list of comments associated with a specific post ID.

      This method returns all comments that are linked to the specified post ID. It is useful for fetching comments for a particular post.

      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the post for which comments are to be fetched
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the list of comments for the post, or an empty Optional if no comments are found

    • countByPostId

      Long countByPostId(Long id)
      Counts the number of comments associated with a specific post ID.

      This method returns the total number of comments that belong to the specified post ID, useful for tracking comment counts for posts.

      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the post for which the comment count is to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the count of comments associated with the post

    • deleteAllByUserId

      void deleteAllByUserId(Long userId)
      Deletes all comments made by a specific user ID.

      This method removes all comments from the database that are associated with the specified user ID. It is useful when a user is deleted or wishes to remove all of their comments.

      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user whose comments are to be deleted

    • deleteAllByPostId

      void deleteAllByPostId(Long postId)
      Deletes all comments associated with a specific post ID.

      This method removes all comments from the database that belong to the specified post ID. It is typically used when a post is deleted.

      Parameters:
      postId - the ID of the post whose comments are to be deleted

    • findByPostId

      List<Comment> findByPostId(Long postId)
      Retrieves a list of comments associated with a specific post ID.

      This method is similar to findAllByPostId(Long), but it returns a non-optional list of comments. It is useful for fetching comments associated with a post when it's guaranteed that comments exist.

      Parameters:
      postId - the ID of the post for which comments are to be fetched
      Returns:
      the list of comments associated with the post

    • findByUserId

      List<Comment> findByUserId(Long userId)
      Retrieves a list of comments associated with a specific user ID.

      This method returns all comments made by the user with the specified user ID. It is useful for fetching comments for a particular user.

      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user for which comments are to be fetched
      Returns:
      the list of comments made by the user
